data.title: Weather in Leipzig in June
data.meta_description: Discover the average weather, temperature and general climate of Leipzig in june. Find cheap flights in june and plan your trip to Leipzig on Avionero
data.text:
The expected average maximum temperature in June is +77°F with a maximum of +91°F and a minimum of +43°F.

The average maximum temperature goes up 0% by the end of the month, compared with the beginning of the month, from +73°F to +73°F.

Leipzig is typically mild in June.

Maximum temperatures go up compared to the previous month from +66°F to +72°F. The minimum temperature also goes up from +48°F to +54°F.

Pack a light jacket as it will be warm in the day and cool in the evenings.

June is one of the warmest months in Leipzig, here is the comparison with other months:

June weather is still as good as in May. It’s getting warmer as June arrives. The average maximum temperature goes up from +66°F to +72°F during the day. Prepare for more rain. Average rainfall goes from 64 mm to 66 mm. Humidity rises from 68% to 69%. Winds are calmer in comparison to May, going down from 3 m/s to 2 m/s on average. The days becoming less sunny, going from 7 sunny days in May to 5 in June.

July brings much the same weather, it remains good.

The average wind speed is 3 m/s getting up to 5 m/s which is a light breeze; barely moving the tree leaves.

The average wind speed in Leipzig is gradually decreasing during June, going from 4 m/s to 3 m/s over the course of the month.

The climate in Leipzig in June has not changed that much over the last 43 years.

The average temperature was the lowest in 1996 (+52°F) and the highest in 2019 (+61°F). The driest year was 2018 with only 357 mm of rainfall, and the wettest year was 2021 with 1744 mm.

For this page, we’ve looked at the typical weather in Leipzig, based on historical hourly weather data from January 1, 1979, to December 31, 2022.

For past dates, we show actual recorded data at the location at that time. Forecasts are based on recorded weather during that day of the year, averaged over the total years for which we have records (unless stated otherwise). The daily temperature is the highest recorded temperature in the shadow during that day.
